intro: Macklottia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plants typically have thick, fleshy leaves and produce small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Macklottia species are popular as ornamental plants due to their compact growth habit and ability to thrive in indoor environments. They require bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to flourish.
